p: The most common symptoms experienced in the 2016 and 2017 outbreaks were, respectively, polyarthritis and muscle pain (71% and 88%), arthralgia (67% and 88%), fatigue (71% and 88%), loss of appetite (52% and 75%), stiff neck (38% and 71%), fever (33% and 47%), rash (9.5% and 65%), headache (28% and 41%), and sore throat (14% and 24%) ( Table). Most personnel recovered within 4â€“6 weeks of symptom onset, except for 3 from the 2016 outbreak who were unfit for deployment 3 months after illness onset because of ongoing signs and symptoms.
